title: Trump Says U.S. Is ‘In Charge’ of Venezuela, While Rubio Stresses Coercing It
summary: The secretary of state said that a military “quarantine” on some oil exports would stay in place to put pressure on the country’s acting leadership.

title: Venezuela’s New Leader Calls for Dialogue and ‘Coexistence’ With U.S.
summary: Acting President Delcy Rodríguez struck a more diplomatic tone than she had on Saturday, inviting the United States to “work together on a cooperative agenda.”

title: Trump Suggests U.S. Could Take Action Against More Countries
summary: On Air Force One, President Trump threatened Colombia and its president, described Cuba as “ready to fall” and reasserted his desire to acquire Greenland.

title: Maduro and His Wife to Be Arraigned in Manhattan Federal Court
summary: Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela’s president, and his wife, Cilia Flores, will make their first appearance on Monday in a New York City courthouse, the site of other high-profile proceedings.

title: In Ukraine, an Arsenal of Killer A.I. Drones Is Being Born in War Against Russia
summary: As the war grinds on, sophisticated Russian defenses have pushed Ukraine to develop a frightening new weapon: semiautonomous killing machines.

title: Ambassador Kimberly Guilfoyle, the Talk of Athens
summary: The former fiancée of Donald Trump Jr., and the former wife of Gov. Gavin Newsom, is working hard and pushing deals with American business interests. She’s also up late at parties.

title: Inside Mamdani’s Decision to Revoke Executive Orders That Backed Israel
summary: Mr. Mamdani, a staunch critic of Israel and its treatment of Palestinians, knew he would not extend the orders, but he had to decide how and when he would rescind them.

title: For Mamdani, a Break With the President Just Three Days Into His New Job
summary: New York City’s newly elected mayor planned to spend Saturday announcing a pedestrian safety plan. Then President Trump brought a captured foreign leader to his doorstep.

title: Mamdani Names Dina Levy as NYC Housing Leader and Pledges ‘Rental Rip-off’ Hearings
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani named a housing commissioner and announced that the city would hold public hearings where frustrated renters could voice their complaints.

title: Critics Choice Awards 2026: The Complete Winners List
summary: “One Battle After Another” won best picture, while the top acting honors went to Timothée Chalamet (“Marty Supreme”) and Jessie Buckley (“Hamnet”).

title: After Christmas Day Strikes, Fear Grips Muslims in Rural Nigeria
summary: A small town set amid a smattering of baobab trees is grappling with the aftermath of a bombing ordered by President Trump.

title: Iran Faces Economic Challenges and Military Threats
summary: Officials said that leaders were in survival mode amid anti-government protests and the prospect of again coming into the cross hairs of Israel and the United States.

title: Yemeni Forces, Backed by Saudi Arabia, Reclaim Territory From Separatists
summary: An offensive by Yemeni government-allied forces appeared to turn the tide in a conflict that has become a proxy clash between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

title: Vaccines Are Helping Older People More Than We Knew
summary: Many shots seem to have “off-target” benefits, such as lowering the risk of dementia, studies have found.

title: China’s Russian Town Has Log Cabins and Cyrillic Signs, but No Russians
summary: Enhe was once home to thousands of ethnic Russians. Under Xi Jinping’s push for ethnic unity, little remains beyond nostalgia and props for tourists.

title: Winter Storms Ease Drought in California, for Now
summary: Experts say that it’s too early to tell what will happen during the rest of the state’s rainy season, but that extreme drought is unlikely.

title: Behind on Student Loans? Here’s What to Do Now for the New Year
summary: Millions of borrowers who are behind can expect the government to tighten repayment options this year. Experts say take action now to get help.

title: The Venezuela I Know
summary: Many are celebrating the ouster of a brutal dictator, but the Maduro regime may survive the loss of Maduro.

title: Tom Brady Is Not the GOAT
summary: That’s not a criticism of Brady. It’s a criticism of how greatness is considered.

title: Robert Heide, Daring Playwright and Warhol Collaborator, Dies at 91
summary: He helped create the Off Off Broadway theater scene, wrote and acted in Andy Warhol’s films, and turned his fascination with collectible Americana into books.

title: Colleen Keating, CEO of Planet Fitness, on Gen Z and Strength Training
summary: Colleen Keating, chief executive of Planet Fitness, wants them to do it in a “judgment-free zone.”

title: One Week Without Smartphones on a College Campus
summary: A student-organized “tech fast” at St. John’s College thrust young people headfirst into a world of chalkboard-based communication. (On that note: Has anyone seen Eliza?)
